description: This Kotlin source file 'MotionUtils.kt' contains utility functions related to motion and haptic feedback used across an Android app. It includes methods to check for reduced motion settings, perform subtle list item animations, bounce animations on taps, perform haptic feedback, and create a custom item animator respecting accessibility settings.

methods.name: isReducedMotionEnabled
methods.description: Checks if the system is configured to reduce or disable animations by examining animation scales and touch exploration settings.

methods.name: animateListItemAppearIfNeeded
methods.description: Performs a subtle fade and scale-in animation on RecyclerView items if animations are enabled and the item hasn't appeared before.

methods.name: animateTapBounce
methods.description: Performs a quick bounce animation on a view to indicate a tap action, respecting reduced motion settings.

methods.name: performHapticClick
methods.description: Triggers a haptic feedback for click-like actions if the device supports it.

methods.name: createSubtleItemAnimator
methods.description: Creates a RecyclerView.ItemAnimator with short durations for move and change animations, disabled if reduced motion is enabled.

methods.name: defaultInterpolator
methods.description: Provides a default interpolator used for animations.

methods.name: getAnimatorDurationScale
methods.description: Retrieves the current global animator duration scale setting from system settings.
